examples: The two friends were joined at the hip during their college years.
He is shooting from the hip in an act of political desperation.
John and Mary are joined at the hip.
She fell downstairs and broke her hip.
Jeff is a straight talker who always shoots from the hip.
words.defineEn: following the fashion of the day and aware of the latest trends
words.defineVi: theo thời trang trong ngày và nhận thức được các xu hướng mới nhất

examples: The magazine keeps tabs on the latest fashion trends.
Gergen had a great sense of news, a good nose for trends, and a wide range of contacts.
The scientist abstracted the data from various sources to analyze trends.
He follows industry blogs and journals to keep up with trends in his profession.
You should avail of the opportunity to attend the conference to network with industry leaders and learn about the latest trends.
words.defineEn: a fashion or style that is popular at a particular time
words.defineVi: một thời trang hoặc phong cách đó là phổ biến tại một thời điểm cụ thể

examples: Her fashion sense is very old school, with vintage dresses and retro accessories.
He prefers high-waisted jeans for a retro style.
Retro prices jumped too.
All right, here comes the retro one.
A retro is a rerelease of an original shoe.
words.defineEn: fashion trends or styles of a recent time in the past
words.defineVi: xu hướng thời trang hoặc phong cách của một thời gian gần đây trong quá khứ

examples: We are very informal around here.
You have some informal actors.
For this particular task, informal actors are much more efficient.
Better yet, it was also informal.
About 81 percent of India's workers ply their trades in the informal economy.
words.defineEn: suitable for friendly, relaxed, casual, or unofficial occasions and situations
words.defineVi: thích hợp cho những dịp và tình huống thân thiện, thoải mái, bình thường hoặc không chính thức

examples: The fashionable boots added a trendy touch to her outfit.
In a trendy vegetarian café, guests enjoy flavorful chickpea and pork cutlets.
They ordered a mouthwatering venison burger from a trendy restaurant.
Avocado toast has become a trendy and delicious breakfast option.
Emily tries to pass herself off as younger by wearing trendy clothes, but she's mutton dressed as lamb.
words.defineEn: influenced by the latest styles
words.defineVi: bị ảnh hưởng bởi các phong cách mới nhất

words.defineEn: a style of fashion marked by the deliberate choice of bland and casual clothes that do not draw attention
words.defineVi: một phong cách thời trang được đánh dấu bằng sự lựa chọn có chủ ý của quần áo nhạt nhẽo và giản dị không thu hút sự chú ý

words.defineEn: the quality of being fashionable and having style
words.defineVi: chất lượng của thời trang và có phong cách

words.defineEn: a style of clothing that is tight-fitting and conforms closely to the body, often emphasizing the contours of the figure
words.defineVi: một kiểu quần áo bó sát và ôm sát vào cơ thể, thường nhấn mạnh các đường nét của hình

words.defineEn: neat, attractive and fashionable
words.defineVi: gọn gàng, hấp dẫn và thời trang

words.defineEn: not following the fashion of the day and unaware of the latest trends
words.defineVi: không theo thời trang trong ngày và không biết về các xu hướng mới nhất

examples: But just 13 minutes before the draft, Tunsil's Twitter was hacked and broadcasted a video of him, well, in an unflattering light.
For a narcissist, self-reflection is hard from an unflattering angle.
It's such an unflattering photo of me anyway.
And I guess dully competent would be the unflattering observation.
First off there's two things I wanna do, first lets just point out how adorable you guys look, and this might be the most unflattering (sisters laughing) coat we had.
words.defineEn: making less attractive or favorable
words.defineVi: làm cho kém hấp dẫn hoặc thuận lợi

words.defineEn: (of a shirt) worn without a tie and not fastened at the neck
words.defineVi: (của một chiếc áo sơ mi) được mặc mà không có cà vạt và không buộc ở cổ

examples: The prime minister's casual remarks about the role of ethnicity in unemployment numbers has predictably put the cat among the pigeons on both sides of the political spectrum.
He rolled up the cuffs of his pants for a more casual look.
They grilled hamburgers and hot dogs for a casual summer dinner.
During his college years, John sowed his oats and enjoyed the freedom of casual relationships.
Emma is a casual dresser and would never be seen dead wearing formal attire or high heels.
words.defineEn: (of clothing) comfortable and suitable for everyday use or informal events and occasions
words.defineVi: (quần áo) thoải mái và phù hợp để sử dụng hàng ngày hoặc các sự kiện và dịp không trang trọng

words.defineEn: wearing clothes that are too casual or inadequate for a particular occasion
words.defineVi: mặc quần áo quá giản dị hoặc không phù hợp cho một dịp cụ thể

examples: The club was becoming noted for its boxing rather than its athletics and this was not welcomed by the runners and walkers.
The homes, the homes are becoming involved.
But in the meantime, chimpanzees were becoming endangered.
Black Americans are becoming infected at a much higher rate than White Americans.
DANIEL FRIED - Well, at this point, I was becoming known as a Russia hawk, OK.
words.defineEn: (of clothes, colors, hairstyles etc.) enhancing the wearer's appearance and making them more attractive
words.defineVi: (về quần áo, màu sắc, kiểu tóc, v.v.) tôn lên vẻ ngoài của người mặc và khiến họ trở nên hấp dẫn hơn

examples: Keep a sharp lookout for David.
With a sharp knife, the chef expertly removed the gristle from the pork chops.
He remained sharp as a tack.
She felt a sharp pain in her hand.
He's as sharp as a tack.
words.defineEn: (of a person's style or clothes) dressy and fashionable
words.defineVi: (về phong cách hoặc quần áo của một người) trang nhã và thời trang

examples: Are you feeling comfortable?
He always wears comfortable clothes when he goes for a run.
He likes the comfortable seats and big screen at the movie theater.
The room had a comfortable bed where she could rest.
The rug in front of the fireplace provides a comfortable spot to sit.
words.defineEn: (of clothes or furniture) making us feel physically relaxed
words.defineVi: (về quần áo hoặc đồ nội thất) khiến chúng ta cảm thấy thoải mái về thể chất

examples: As Jessica watched her son's new girlfriend interact with their family, she couldn't help but feel a bit uncomfortable, considering that the girl appeared to be old enough to be his mother.
After walking all day in uncomfortable shoes, Jane exclaimed, "My dogs are barking!"
Eating a big meal right before bed doesn't sit right with me - I always end up feeling bloated and uncomfortable.
Real eyes realise, and it's time for us to start confronting the uncomfortable truths about our society.
That chair looks super uncomfortable.
words.defineEn: (of clothes, furniture, etc.) unpleasant to use or wear; making someone physically uneasy
words.defineVi: (về quần áo, đồ nội thất, v.v.) khó sử dụng hoặc mặc; làm cho ai đó khó chịu về thể chất

words.defineEn: (of clothes) chic and suitable for formal occasions
words.defineVi: (quần áo) sang trọng và thích hợp cho những dịp trang trọng

examples: The grand unified theory is compact and elegant in mathematical terms.
You can impress your guests with an elegant millet-stuffed bell pepper dish.
She looks a million dollars in her elegant evening gown and flawless makeup.
They hosted a dinner party and served an elegant three-course meal that began with a light scrod ceviche.
The British accent is often considered elegant and distinctive.
words.defineEn: (of a person or their behavior) attractive, stylish, or beautiful
words.defineVi: (của một người hoặc hành vi của họ) hấp dẫn, phong cách hoặc xinh đẹp

examples: Actually that is quite fetching.
words.defineEn: attractive in a way that catches the eye
words.defineVi: hấp dẫn theo cách bắt mắt

words.defineEn: (of clothes) made in a way that closely covers the body
words.defineVi: (về quần áo) được làm theo cách ôm sát cơ thể

examples: The flamboyant businessman is still sitting pretty.
One of the most fascinating things about bearded dragons is their flamboyant non-verbal communication.
MALCOLM BRABANT: Britain's most flamboyant Druid, King Arthur Pendragon, is on the warpath.
MALCOLM BRABANT: Britain's most flamboyant Druid, King Arthur Pendragon, is on the warpath.
But in many places, scientists are seeing something else: colorful corals, in flamboyant greens, reds, pinks, and purples.
words.defineEn: (of clothes) showy and noticeable because of being brightly colored or highly decorated
words.defineVi: (quần áo) sặc sỡ và đáng chú ý vì có màu sắc rực rỡ hoặc được trang trí cao

examples: She had no formal instruction in music.
Dinner was very formal, with everyone on their best behaviour.
He used to wear a silk tie with his formal suit.
He asked her wife to wear a formal dress to the event.
Emma is a casual dresser and would never be seen dead wearing formal attire or high heels.
words.defineEn: suitable for fancy, important, serious, or official occasions and situations
words.defineVi: thích hợp cho những dịp và tình huống ưa thích, quan trọng, nghiêm túc hoặc chính thức

words.defineEn: (of clothing) fitting the body tightly in a way that the contours of the figure are clearly seen
words.defineVi: (quần áo) vừa vặn với cơ thể để có thể nhìn thấy rõ các đường nét của hình

words.defineEn: unfashionable and unattractive
words.defineVi: không hợp thời trang và không hấp dẫn

examples: Don't worry mum, we made it snappy!

I wish I could make it big in my career and keep on moving quickly, you know, keep on making it snappy.
This is a lot more snappy.
Storage should be extremely snappy on this machine.
words.defineEn: neat and stylish
words.defineVi: gọn gàng và phong cách

examples: I'm stone sober, so I'll drive us home.

The business owner reflected on his own youthful mistakes, acknowledging that wanton kittens make sober cats, and that his early errors had taught him valuable lessons that he applied to his business practices.
Sobering stuff at the end of this week.
My daughter has been sober 17 months now.
They was sobering.
words.defineEn: plain and not brightly colored
words.defineVi: đơn giản và không có màu sắc rực rỡ

examples: Overall, the interior of the Lamborghini Urus feels ferociously sporty and exquisitely premium.

The Tesla T-logo is now a very sporty red as opposed to chrome.
And also it looks sporty and that's what we aim for.
The German sports sedan BMW replaced the 02 series with the 3-series in 1975, and since that time, the small sporty car has been the sports sedan to beat.
words.defineEn: (of clothes) stylish, attractive, and suitable for sports
words.defineVi: (quần áo) phong cách, hấp dẫn và phù hợp với thể thao

examples: My dad bought a stylish suit for his friend's wedding.

He feels a million dollars as he walks down the street, receiving compliments on his stylish appearance.
words.defineEn: attractive in a way that is fashionable and elegant
words.defineVi: hấp dẫn theo cách thời trang và thanh lịch

words.defineEn: in a fashionable way that shows style
words.defineVi: một cách thời trang thể hiện phong cách

examples: I mean the flapper dresses are just so chic.

(everyone yelling) - You look chic.

words.defineEn: having an appealing appearance that is stylish
words.defineVi: có vẻ ngoài hấp dẫn, phong cách

words.defineEn: (used especially of clothes) showy in a way that is tasteless
words.defineVi: (được sử dụng đặc biệt là quần áo) sặc sỡ một cách vô vị

examples: They think she's too glamorous and won't want to speak to them.

For most soldiers, there was nothing glamorous or heroic about this war.
words.defineEn: attractive in a special way
words.defineVi: hấp dẫn một cách đặc biệt

words.defineVi: liên quan đến phong cách thời trang gắn liền với nhạc grunge rock, bao gồm quần jean rách rộng và nhiều lớp quần áo

examples: This is sloppy stuff.

words.defineVi: (của một bộ quần áo) giản dị và rộng rãi, không có nhiều hình dạng

examples: Two could play at that game, smart guy.

She's not too smart, but at least her heart is in the right place.
words.defineEn: (of people or clothes) looking neat, tidy, and elegantly fashionable
words.defineVi: (về người hoặc quần áo) trông gọn gàng, ngăn nắp và hợp thời trang

words.defineEn: (of clothes) neat, conventional and rather informal
words.defineVi: (về quần áo) gọn gàng, thông thường và khá trang trọng

examples: It's all used really well and really smartly.

words.defineEn: in a neat and stylish way
words.defineVi: một cách gọn gàng và phong cách

words.defineEn: wearing clothes that are too formal or excessive for a particular occasion
words.defineVi: mặc quần áo quá trang trọng hoặc quá mức cho một dịp cụ thể

examples: Though I suppose Trump's bread and butter is putting up garish eyesores.
These are available in white and gray and nord blue, which I think looks pretty garish.
That’s a garish, systemic damage to the system.
words.defineEn: too bright and colorful in a way that is tasteless
words.defineVi: quá sáng và đầy màu sắc theo cách vô vị

examples: In New York especially, it's a lot of streetwear.
Many other big brands are now adopting this method of very limited releases to generate hype around their products, from trainers to other streetwear brands.
Under Michele's leadership, Gucci has come to embrace streetwear and the influence of popular culture.

To that end, pet owners are purchasing indulgent items like premium pet food, daily supplements, tech gadgets, clothing and even matching streetwear.
words.defineEn: informal clothing that the urban youth of a particular subculture typically wear
words.defineVi: trang phục không chính thức mà thanh niên thành thị của một nhóm văn hóa cụ thể thường mặc

words.defineEn: improving or emphasizing someone's good features, making them appear more attractive
words.defineVi: cải thiện hoặc nhấn mạnh các tính năng tốt của ai đó, làm cho họ trông hấp dẫn hơn

examples: The music was far too loud for my liking.

words.defineEn: too bright in a distasteful way
words.defineVi: quá sáng một cách khó chịu
